content.description:
The Haxan Cloak climbs a featured arete on perfect edges over a great landing.

Sit start with a pair of finned edges below the arete. From there, stick a sloping right hand edge, set a heel-toe cam, bump the right to the arete, follow with a left to another sloping edge, then work the big shelf above, get the feet up, and top out the remaining arete on good edges.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work great. The landing is flat and clear, but there is a rock back and right of the problem.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Cedarpelta.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of sidepulls about seven feet off the deck. From there, bump up to a left hand jug, follow with a match on the mini-shelf above,  work a three-finger pocket, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work great, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the southern section of Cedarpelta's east face.

content.description: Buzz Bomb has the perfect sit start!
content.location:
This is the start to

Buzz Bomb

.

content.description:
Buzz Bomb climbs the center of the east face on impeccable rock.

Stand start with your left hand on an excellent incut crimp about chest height. Get your right hand above your head on a bulbous, slopey feature. Pull onto the boulder, and make a difficult move up and left to a gaston crimp. Finish straight up with a couple of slopey rails and a huck to a large cookie hold above the lip.
content.protection: A couple of pads. There's a small boulder in the landing area, but it's flat and easily padded.
content.location: It is in the middle of the east face of the Cedarpelta Block.

content.description:
Air Guided Farmer climbs an undercut, vertical face on perfect edges over an equally impressive landing. Despite its short duration, the problem climbs well.

Stand start with a hands about six feet off the deck on a pair of oblique edges and a high right foot edge. From there, bump the right hand through a series of edges to the arete, then dyno to a sloping left hand edge about a foot below the lip, from there, get your feet, hit the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will do fine, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the east face, just left of Cedarpelta's northeast arete.
